result.execSummary:
The defendant Romel L Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Romel L Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Romel L Scott was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a $100.00 per month commencing 2/01/15 with payment plan fee of $15.00 and DNA Surcharge.  Alternate 12 days jail.
DNA to be paid with fine on payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romel L Scott

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Romel L Scott in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 6,  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 dismissed without prejudice.  

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1:
- 38 days jail - Credit for 38 days. Court orders Time Served.
- Fine totaling $379.00 to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 02/01/2015; alternate 12 days jail
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - append to fine
filed by the State.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: December 11, 2014 Jury Status Hearing and December 16, 2014 Jury Trail.  Envelope: Return to Sender - Attempted not known - Unable to Forward.

Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: December 11, 2014 Jury Status Hearing and December 16, 2014 Jury Trial.  Defendant is no longer residing at the Waukesha County Jail.  Copy mailed to new address.

Defendant to have no contact with Nathaniel N. or Marquita B.. Defendant is not to go within 1/2 mile of Summit Avenue in Waukesha or any other residence of Marquita B. Defendant to live with his mother at 2166 N. 40th Street, MIlwaukee, WI.. Standard conditions apply.
to modify bail filed by Atty. Schubert

Defendant Romel L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail motion filed and addressed by counsel. State opposes the modification. Court modifies bail to $10,000 signature bond with conditions. Defense requests a date for status/trial. Court grants request.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Romel L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed. Bail can to review before the trial court. 
  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Court removed the condition: defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. All other conditions remain as set as follows: Defendant to have no contact with  any victim/witness or her residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety.

Defendant Romel L Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Andrew McNulty, City of Waukesha, sworn and testified. State presents closing argument and moves for bindover. Attorney Schubert moves for dismissal and presents closing argument.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Attorney Schubert request court hear bail motion. State has no objection and hears bail arguments. State objects to modification of bail. Court denies motion to modify bail, but strikes the condition that defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
